attributes.action: Make getting a tattoo legal at 16 legal with parental consent.
attributes.background: Waiting to be 18 to get a tattoo can be a long, hard wait but sometimes, not everyone can reach it. It's devastating. If getting a tattoo at 16 becomes legal with the parent's consent then people can get something symbolic before they go. This, I hope is something that many others will agree on.

attributes.action: Reverse the planned ban on letting agent fees to tenants
attributes.background: The UK Government is currently putting a bill through Parliament to ban letting agents or landlords from charging any fees to tenants for renting a home. This ban will likely put costs to tenants up so we would like to see it reversed before primary legislation is passed as a cap is more appropriate
attributes.additional_details: A ban on fees to tenants will simply push these costs onto landlords who are a long way from all being able to afford them. This will drive up rents and drive down standards and, crucially, reduce supply as landlords are squeezed on top of recent tax changes. Asking prospective tenants to make a reasonable contribution to the vetting process is in no way unreasonable and a cap is a perfectly workable compromise. The Government’s broken housing policy needs private landlords right now.

attributes.action: Same sex married couples should be able to divorce on grounds of adultery
attributes.background: When the UK Government welcomed same sex marriage and updated the Marriage Act accordingly, they neglected to sufficiently update the divorce law. We are now living in a country where same sex couples cannot divorce under the grounds of adultery. Where is the equality? Equal rights for all.
attributes.additional_details: Adultery is not legally recognised as grounds for marriage dissolution in the UK. The message this sends out is that the laws will selectively discriminate. It also shows a lack of foresight and planning - always check your dependencies (cause and effect of law changes).

attributes.action: To have a public holiday on 21 October to be called Trafalgar Day.
attributes.background: To commemorate one of the greatest days in our history.  We should be proud of that victory in 1805.  It is long overdue.

attributes.action: Conjugal Visits Allowed In The UK To Stop Reoffending.
attributes.background: In the summer of 2014, The Howard League released a report entitled Sex in Prison. It explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe, Canada and even the Middle East. Dr Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper.
attributes.additional_details: The Howard League released a report where it explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe. Lorraine Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper who visited Halden prison in Norway in 2014, where conjugal visits are allowed. As a result, Norway has one of the lowest reoffending rates in the world, currently standing at 20%. In comparison, 59% of British prisoners reoffend within a year of being released.

attributes.action: Stop employers referring to contracted hours employment as a "minimum".
attributes.background: In many contracts, (especially in retail), the hours expected for an employee to work are stated as a "minimum". This wording, in effect, allows the employer to require you to work above your minimum working hours without having to pay you overtime.
attributes.additional_details: The wording of all employment contracts should be absolutely clear as to the expected working hours of the employment. There should be no ambiguity to allow the employer to achieve "free labour" from the technical wording of their contract. If an employer requires an employee to work hours in excess of their contract, this should be reimbursed through overtime payments.

attributes.action: Make the purchase of fireworks without a permit & I.D illegal.
attributes.background: The number of emergency calls received by police relating to fireworks & their misuse could be reduced if retailers recorded who they sell to & require the buyer to present a firework permit issued in a similar way that a person may apply for a private event permit meaning less antisocial behaviour
attributes.additional_details:
If you have ever called the police because fireworks are being used in dangerous ways you may have been told its not a priority despite a firework being able to cause major injuries, with a permit and ID required to purchase fireworks less youths will be able to purchase fireworks, to reinforce this 
All retailers should record the details of who bought the fireworks, when, how many of which type. In doing so it will be easy to identify law abiding retailers by checking sales records and stock

attributes.action: Introduce a 10% maximum limit on a university's intake from independent schools.
attributes.background: 7% of children in Britain go to an independent school. In this age of soaring inequality, the fact that around 40% of offers of a place at Oxbridge, and around 25% from the Russell Group of top universities, go to these students is simply shocking. It is 2017, not 1917. Enough is enough.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite promises from the top universities to improve their systems for admissions, figures released by MP David Lammy, show the situation to be worsening. 82% of offers from Oxford and 81% from Cambridge went to students from the top two socio-economic groups in 2015, up from 79% at both universities five years earlier.* 

The government must act. A withdrawl of public funding, plus significant fines for offending institutions should be implemented immediately.

*The Guardian 19 10 2017

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using lane 2 between 06:00 to 22:00 hrs on 2 lane highways
attributes.background:
With the introduction of 4 lane smart motorways traffic congestion is worse than ever. HGV's are now actively using lanes 1,2 & 3 restricting every other vehicle to lane 4.

On 2 lane highways they sit side by side for mile after mile unable to pass and holding up other faster moving vehicles.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Between 06:00 and 22:00 hrs no HGV may use lane 2.
2. If the overtaking HGV is unable to pass a slower vehicle in under 90 seconds and safely pull in back in then the move should not be attempted.
3. HGV's must not use lane 3 on "smart" motorways.
4. HGV's up to 7.5 tonnes may not use lane 4 on smart motorways, anyone found doing so should receive 6 penalty points and a £1000 fine. Use of the overhead cameras to identify culprits could be used.

attributes.action: Award long service medals to doctors and nurses in the NHS
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services (police, fire and ambulance) are all awarded a long service medal after 20 years service but no recognition of long service is made for doctors and nurses who work in an equally challenging role, often dealing at the end point of emergencies.

attributes.action: All government agencies to stop using marital status titles for women
attributes.background:
Current marital status title's for women: Miss – unmarried Mrs – married Ms – divorced. 

Propose to replace with Ms only to indicate a female. This is aligned with Mr to indicate a male.
attributes.additional_details:
A women's place in society is no longer dictated by her marital status. 

Requesting marital status on all applications/forms has no relevance and the government agencies should update this archaic practise and be brought in line and equal with men, where only a gender acknowledgement is required.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the old National Curriculum sub‐divided level grading system
attributes.background: From September 2014, the Government made huge changes in the way that students were to be assessed. This was a new way of thinking for schools, looking very different to the previous 20 years. These changes have created confusion among students and parents while decreasing student motivation.
attributes.additional_details: With the old grading system, there was little a correlation between a level and a child’s year group, and this can be seen in the way that in a Year 6 class there could be a range of levels, from level 2 to a level 6. However, the new National Curriculum sets out a mark scheme of a simple emerging, developing, secure, mastery.

attributes.action: Make government condemn the violence of Spain's police against the Catalans
attributes.background: On the day of the Catalonia independence referendum, Spain's national police used batons and rubber bullets to attack people who were peacefully attempting to cast their vote. Approximately 890 Catalans were injured. Let's make our government stand against brutalising peaceful voters.
attributes.additional_details: The response to a peaceful referendum should never be violence, especially not by the police force that should serve and protect the Catalans. The UK foreign ministry has refused to condemn the Spanish authorities. This is unacceptable to me. I therefore would like to express that I and my fellow citizens do condemn the heinous violence of Spain's national police towards their citizens . Hopefully we will be heard.

attributes.action: Create a Government of Shared Unity
attributes.background: Whereby the position of Prime minister is replaced by a parliamentary body consisting of representatives from each party which gained a significant number of votes in the election.
attributes.additional_details: Democracy voted that not one single party should lead Government. To solve issues, and to conclude  Brexit well, Great Britain needs a group of people standing for the best principles from major parties. The needs of Great Britain are large and complex, and can not be resolved by the ideas of one single party. We do not need a dictator; we need a group of passionate people who want to resolve the problems of Great Britain from every aspect-the environment; financially; socially... the list goes on.

attributes.action: Allow young people who are members of a political party to vote at 16.
attributes.background: Young people who have a political party membership should be allowed to vote at 16 because being a member of a party shows a basic if not good understanding of politics.

attributes.action: The UK must expel the North Korean ambassador
attributes.background:
North Korea is a rogue state threatening the entire world.  They are extreme cybercriminals, exporters of terrorism, and have now ramped up their nuclear weapons programme in defiance of UN sanctions and international outcry.

We must send a strong message by expelling their ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
Other countries which have expelled their North Korean ambassador include: Spain; Kuwait; Peru; Mexico; and Botswana.  Meanwhile Egypt, the Philippines, and Uganda have drastically scaled back diplomatic ties.

London has an (est. 20,000) Korean community from both North and South.  North Korean "enforcers" spy on this community as well as locals (who aren't always Korean) near the embassy, intimidating people who joke about the country or regime.

They shouldn't benefit from life in London.

attributes.action: Rebate and partially rebate stamp duty on properties purchased since 22/11/16
attributes.background: The new stamp duty rules for houses under 300k and only partial for above is great news for new buyers. I was a new buyer 5 months ago and struggled to get stamp duty together.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that following the chancellor’s revelation on the 22/11/17, all properties purchased within the last 12 months, particularly ones purchased using help to buy, should have partial or full refunds on the stamp duty in line with the chancellor’s new ruled surrounding stamp duty

attributes.action: Prevent the DVLA from selling personal information to outside companies
attributes.background: It has come to light that the DVLA are selling personal information to parking companies for the purpose of pursuing individuals in respect of alleged parking offences

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Homes under £300000 for all buyers
attributes.background: Why only abolish stamp duty on houses under £300000 for first time buyers as a lot of families moving home would benefit from this too. Most first time buyers won’t benefit as much as families upsizing their house and the saving would incentify buying

attributes.action: Establish an independent board that investigates complaints against the Police
attributes.background: After our own personal experiences of accessing the Police Complaints System we soon realised it is not fit for purpose.  We  represent a large number of victims  and all of those who have made a complaint to the Police have either not had their complaint investigated or had a satisfactory outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Presently the Police investigate themselves and this is obvious it is open to misconduct.  We and our victims we represent have complained to the IPCC on numerous occasions and they will not investigate the Police often sending the complaint straight back to the Professional Standards Department.  We want a Police Complaints system totally independent to the Police made up of members trained in Law and with civilian oversight and a number of victims of crime on the panel.

attributes.action: Change the way fines i.e. Speeding/Drunk and Disorderly are calculated.
attributes.background: Instead of a fixed price fine we should have a proportional fine so it affects each person the same way, it should be 10% of the offending persons average weekly wage (10% of 1/52th, 1 weeks worth, of last year's net pay) or a minimum of £80, whichever is the greater.
attributes.additional_details:
This way it have much more of an equal affect upon the culprit and even out some balance of a unfair prosecution system which effects the poorest more.

For example in October this year (2017) a professional footballer was caught speeding and was fined £440, alot of money for a person on minimum wage but does not have the same impact on someone reportedly earning £37,500 per week. This may be an extreme example however I feel this change allow punishment to be felt equally across the board.

attributes.action: Stop companies from draining UK taxable profits and cap ‘Earnings Stripping’
attributes.background: UK companies’ taxable profits and therefore the government’s tax revenue spend on welfare is being systematically drained by large multinationals in order to subsidise their global monopolization and to pay their mega-rich owners even more billions each year.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on switching the British election system over to MMP
attributes.background: The British FPTP election system has lead to an unproportional Parliament not representing the wants of the British people with parties being able to get a majority with just 30 precent of the vote.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have never voted on a truly proportional voting system with AV being heavily flawed and with the referendum in question having a turn out of just 40% many voters wanted something else. MMP keeps constituencies and thus the constituent link.
Source:https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixed-member_proportional_representation

attributes.action: Teach the law of the UK and our Human Rights mandatory in the curriculum.
attributes.background: I am currently a student at a High School in the UK. I find it shocking that we learn complicated mathematics, most of which would only be useful in careers specializing in it, the history of the world, yet we don't know our human rights and the laws of the country we live in.
attributes.additional_details: There are people being denied their human rights in this great nation of ours, without knowing it. People are being arrested for crimes they didn't even know existed. Why are students being taught about life in Weimar Germany but not the laws of modern-day UK?

attributes.action: Ban or reduce the excessive brightness of LED or HID high intensity car lights
attributes.background:
Car head lights are now so bright that it's hard to see driving in the dark because you get blinded by the oncoming cars with high intensity discharge (hid) or led driving lights.
The law needs to be changed to greatly reduce the brightness.

attributes.action: Fine* patients who do not attend (DNA) NHS hospital appointments.
attributes.background:
DNAs: 
- Cost the NHS an estimated £225 million in 2012 to 2013° 
- Result in extended waiting lists 
- Are an inefficient use of staff 
- Occurred in around 5.6 million (9% of the total) NHS outpatient appointments in England between 2014 to 2015°° 
(See additional details for sources °and°°)
attributes.additional_details:
Appointments where a patient does not show or provide prior notice are regarded as DNAs (did not attend). 
*To reduce DNAs, provide an incentive from as little as a £1 circumstantial charge to encourage patients to cancel. Thus freeing a space for those who can attend the appointment.
°Source: The National Audit Office 
°°Source: Quarterly Hospital Activity Data, 2015
Additional information:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hospitals-and-patients-urged-to-take-action-on-missed-appointments

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for people to pass a politics test before they can vote
attributes.background: Make it a requirement for people to have to pass a political competency test in order to be allowed to vote in General Elections, or in Nationwide Referendums. Brexit is a stark reminder; it only takes a small percentage of the population to be politically uneducated to sway a huge national decision
attributes.additional_details: A exam to test background knowledge of basic political systems, taken a few weeks before an upcoming election. This could then be marked over the following days, and anyone who passed will be sent a verification code or something similar to enable them to vote on Election Day. An in depth analysis of how the population did overall on the exam could then be published, allowing political parties to see what areas of knowledge/ which demographics they could address in future election campaigns.

attributes.action: Provide a 9-1 GCSE Law syllabus and encourage examination boards to follow it.
attributes.background: GCSE law is a great qualification as it allows students who do not have the knowledge to perform at a-level to show their ability in another way. Sadly, all the exam boards that provide the subject will scrap it in 2018. This petition calls on the government to provide a syllabus after that.
attributes.additional_details:
"GCSE Law helps students to develop skills of selection, analysis, critical thinking and decision making, and builds an awareness of the rights and responsibilities of individuals" AQA
Without this subject, we risk causing a lack of knowledge around students who no longer have any reason to study law at 16. All the exam boards... Namely OCR and AQA plan to abolish the subject! http://www.aqa.org.uk/subjects/law/gcse/law-4160
http://www.ocr.org.uk/qualifications/gcse-law-j485-from-2012/

attributes.action: Make road cycling safer by introducing a law to enforce reflective clothing.
attributes.background: I am a cyclist and a motorist, but i feel strongly that too many cyclists are not aware that they are not visible in dark clothing. By introducing a law, we can help cut down road traffic accidents involving cyclists and improve their general safety.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I are members of Catford Cycling Club - which is one of the oldest in the U.K. We have been cycling many years. I regularly have to make cyclists aware that they are not visible on the road.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of germ spreading by licking fingers to open bags/give out paper
attributes.background: Many stores have staff who decide to lick their fingers to make it easier to open carrier bags. This is a serious health and safety issue as it can cause the spread of illnesses and diseases. It is very unhygienic and disgusting and shouldn't be the norm. They can use water instead.
attributes.additional_details: Licking fingers is also often done within schools, organisations and institutions where they give out papers, forms and applications etc. The UK Government needs to launch an awareness campaign to help stop this unhygienic practice.

attributes.action: Make Legal Provision for Northwest Regions of the UK to hold a Legal Referendum.
attributes.background: The referendum will give all citizens in the North a chance to vote on uniting UK Northern Regions to form an autonomous independent country breaking away from the South & the UK Government with Manchester as a Northern Capital with an elected Minister best placed to serve the citizens of N/England.
attributes.additional_details: Northern citizens suffer from lower life expectancy, lack of investment in areas such as education, health, skilled training and quality employment opportunities. Lack of political influence in London/South effects the Norths capability for economic growth. The neglect in these  areas is at such an extent that the North & South could be viewed as separate countries already. (One Example) IPPR thinktank, DT infrastructure spending 2016/17 London £1,943 per person, Northwest Region £680pp.

attributes.action: Employers’ Education Tax to contribute towards university tuition fee costs
attributes.background:
Employers currently receive the rewards of a highly educated workforce but contribute little or nothing towards the educational costs of their employees.
Employers should pay a 1% tax rate on the gross salary of all employees to help fund the tuition fee costs of all students entering university.
attributes.additional_details:
The new 1% Employers Education Tax will go towards eliminating the tuition fee liability on all existing UK graduates and providing free university tuition fee for all current and future UK students leaving further education.
In addition, individuals who may have missed the opportunity to go to university and who may now, or in the future, wish to pursue a university degree for whatever purpose will be encouraged to apply at all stages of their life and be funded to do so.

attributes.action: Stop Parliamentary recess for Party Annual Conferences
attributes.background: I passionately believe the Parliament of the United Kingdom fails to serve the country efficiently as it is 'closed' too often and for excessive periods. If Party Conferences are necessary they should be held during summer recess or another recess period.

attributes.action: change workplace drugs tests. Oral mouth swabs should be the compulsory method.
attributes.background: Urine based testing is a demeaning and very personal method of testing. Oral mouth swabs is a easy and non-invasive method. It is the method used by police for road users and should be made the compulsory method for the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: Oral mouth swabs has the ability to detect drug use within the first few hours. This is a window of time that is omitted by urine tests. Mouth swabs, with their ability to detect drug use 1-4 days after use, are the best method for impairment and post-accident testing.

attributes.action: Allow everyone over 55 flexibility to manage their private pension
attributes.background: The Pension Schemes Act 2015 allowed individuals from the age of 55 to be able to access their pension flexibility if they wish, but not if you had already accessed your pension prior to the new Act coming into force. I want this Government to give us the same rights to manage our pension as we wish

attributes.action: Call on PM to take action to build public trust in the Grenfell Tower Inquiry
attributes.background: Bereaved families & survivors call on PM to exercise her powers under the Inquiries Act 2005 to appoint additional panel members with decision making power to sit alongside Chair in Grenfell Tower Inquiry: to ensure those affected have confidence in & are willing to fully participate in the Inquiry

attributes.action: Make ice cream van drivers pass a DBS check before attaining a trading license
attributes.background: Some ice cream drivers have been abusing their position by grooming and sexually abusing children. Let’s make our children and communities safe. Click the links in “more details” for some articles, google it and you’ll sadly find more. Make it legislation they must pass a DBS check prior to trading.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/wirral-ice-cream-seller-jailed-5373318.amp

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/wfla.com/2017/10/30/man-who-sells-ice-cream-in-bradenton-arrested-for-sexually-assaulting-6-year-old-girl/amp/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/amp.fox13news.com/news/local-news/ice-cream-man-accused-of-molesting-6-year-old-girl

attributes.action: Make prostitution legal in order to make sex workers safe and keep them healthy.
attributes.background: For our citizenship GCSE qualification, we must choose an issue that we believe needs attention, and should be discussed as many people are being affected by the stigma on sex workers.This affects their health and safety as they are scared to be tested for STIs or report cases such as rape or abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Before creating this petition, we did research on both the advantages and disadvantages of legalizing prostitution and how it would affect people. We also conducted primary research and gave out a questionnaire in school asking teachers their opinion on the issue and explaining how people, especially sex workers, would benefit if it were legal. 61% of the teachers agreed that it should be legalized before we told them the advantages and disadvantages, and 75% agreed after learning the benefits.

attributes.action: Extend the 16-19 transport bursary to pupils placed in an Independent setting.
attributes.background: This bursary is supposed to enable pupils from families on a low income to access education and/ or training by meeting transport costs. The eligibility assumes pupils are not in Independent settings, but local authorities who cannot provide for some with additional needs often use such placements.
attributes.additional_details: The result is that families on a low income with children who have additional needs are financially discriminated against. Often the reason many families with a child who has additional needs are on a low income is due to the care needs of that child.

attributes.action: Make a Mother Earth Rights Act
attributes.background: Follow the example of Bolivia and Ecuador, make a law which gives Mother Earth, trees and creatures legal personage. This would help lawyers to better advocate on behalf of nature- this would have been particularly useful in the case of Sheffields street trees and against fracking in beauty spots.
attributes.additional_details: Review the Universal declaration of the rights of mother earth (Cochabamba, Bolivia, 22 April) and impliment some of the legal protections into UK law. To give stronger protection to the environment and to forfil UK obligations to the Convention of Biological Diversity.

attributes.action: Make all types of packaging 100% recyclable or biodegradable
attributes.background: All forms of packaging for every type of product made within, imported to or exported from the UK should be 100% recyclable or biodegradable

attributes.action: Require all car manufactures to offer retrofitting of L.E.D DRL
attributes.background:
I acknowledge that it is now a legal requirement for new cars to be fitted with DRL, however older vehicles can be retrofitted with them as they have a lot of benefits.
The point of the petition is to make it a legal requirement for all car manufactures to offer retrofitting LED DRL's
attributes.additional_details:
In the research conducted by the European Commision in 2006 it has been confirmed that they have potential in reducing road deaths due to making the vehicle more visible to other road users during the day and are then switched off when sidelights/dipped lights are switched on. 

Third party retrofitting systems are available but are not very reliable, hence why I wish all car manufactures to offer LED DRL's that would be installed by the manufacturer themselves.

attributes.action: Make sure that development of new drugs is not adversely affected by BREXIT.
attributes.background: The Government must commit to following the current process for all drugs already in the EU clinical trial and approval pipeline.
attributes.additional_details:
Doctors and drug companies work in many countries to develop a drug.  Drugs in development now will be in Clinical Trial both before and after March 2019.

Bodies like the European Medicines Agency regulate drug approval with a single set of regulations and approval steps. 

Developing effective treatments for debilitating diseases will greatly reduce the long-term financial and social cost to the UK.

https://www.ft.com/content/e3e9ac6a-5f2d-11e7-8814-0ac7eb84e5f1

attributes.action: Hold a Public Inquiry into >45000 extra deaths linked to austerity since 2010
attributes.background: A recent study published in the BMJ showed a correlation between cuts to social and healthcare funding and higher than expected national mortality rates since 2010. A Public Inquiry should be held in order to determine whether Government Austerity measures have led to an increase in death rate.
attributes.additional_details:
Long term under funding of health and social care services has led to widespread suffering, a decline physical and mental health and vulnerable people being put at risk. Lack of funding may also be responsible for >45000 deaths since 2010. If this is the case, harmful government action and policy must be reversed and responsible politicians held to account over these deaths.

Study: http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/7/11/e017722

attributes.action: Make Falconry in the UK licensed.
attributes.background:
Here in the UK, we are one of the only countries in the world, that does not have a falconry license.
There is a huge issue where anyone can own and breed and sell birds of prey, to people who have no experience. 
I encounter 10-12 owls and Hawks each year kept in parrot cages and rabbit hutches
attributes.additional_details:
There's 1000s of people who have birds of prey, some of these birds can kill animals up the the size of deer, so effectively they're equivalent to a dangerous weapon. 
There needs to be control on the ownership or at the least, a strict mentoring system.

attributes.action: Lower the price of road tax for petrol and increase the price for diesel
attributes.background: It is said that Diesel cars emit more harmful pollutants, why should road tax be so much cheaper for diesel? it only encourages more people to use diesel.

attributes.action: Ban vans parking and blocking views of crossings&driveways
attributes.background: Van drivers don’t realise that parking where they do can cause view of drivers pulling off of driveways and people waiting to cross and bus stops etc

attributes.action: Prevent UK universities classifying British citizens as international students.
attributes.background:
Currently, a British citizen must live in the UK for the 3 years before starting university. This discriminates against citizens who have lived abroad. 

The loose fee-status specifications allow for different institutions to classify the same student as an international and a home student.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite being a British citizen, I am currently paying £20,000 per year to attend Durham University. 

The Department for Education justifies this by claiming British Citizens who have lived abroad have no access to public funds when they return to the UK, but there is no equivalent barrier to benefits, the NHS, or similar means of public funds. 

This is a call to end the discrimination, not a request to access the Students Loan Company. This is a demand to be treated as equal.

attributes.action: Change and restrict the dates for sale of fireworks around bonfire night.
attributes.background: We all know that bans do not work, we all know that bonfire night isn't going anywhere, but did you know that the sale of fireworks around bonfire night starts from the 15th of October to the 8th of November that's 25 days of sale. Potentially 4 weeks of fireworks going off in any one area.
attributes.additional_details:
There are members of the public who are not sensible and continuously break the law, setting off fireworks in proximity to peoples homes and even terrorising and subjecting abuse to other members of the public for up to the whole 4 weeks of sale. Unfortunately animals are also very easily abused with fireworks too, many incidents include tieing them to animals and setting them off.
I call to get the sale dates changed and restricted to less than 14 days around the time of bonfire night.

attributes.action: Reject the ratification of the Unitary Patent treaty by the UK and Scotland
attributes.background: The Unitary Patent contain articles which refers to the supremacy of the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU), while politicians have promised to respect the democratic Brexit vote of UK citizens to leave the EU; The UPC court will provide case law in favor of software patents.
attributes.additional_details: For a more complete and lengthy petition, see http://nounitarysoftwarepatents.uk
